intro: Aneilema gramineum var. affine, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often dark green with a velvety texture, and it produces vibrant flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. This species is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
